UNITED STATES CODE
Title 4 - First Amendment Rights

Chapter 3 - FIRST AMENDMENT RIGHTS

§ 3666. First Amendment Rights provisions

(a) GENERAL RULE.—The provisions of this section shall apply to all matters involving first amendment rights under federal jurisdiction.

(b) DEFINITIONS.—In this section:
    (1) The term "first amendment rights" means the legal framework, procedures, and standards established for first amendment rights under federal law.
    (2) The term "federal jurisdiction" means the authority exercised by federal courts and agencies.

(c) REQUIREMENTS.—
    (1) All covered entities must comply with federal standards for first amendment rights.
    (2) Compliance includes adherence to procedural requirements and substantive standards.
    (3) Documentation and reporting requirements must be satisfied as specified.

(d) ENFORCEMENT.—
    The Attorney General may bring enforcement actions for violations of first amendment rights requirements. Civil penalties and injunctive relief are available remedies.

(e) EFFECTIVE DATE.—This section shall take effect 114 days after the date of enactment.

(f) REGULATIONS.—The Secretary may prescribe regulations necessary to carry out this section.

Enacted: 2018-06-13
Public Law: 115-401
